verses.text: But as for you, speak what agrees with sound teaching.
verses.comment: Paul exhorts Titus to teach only faithful doctrine. The word 'sound' refers to healthy, life-giving teaching.

verses.text: Older men are to be sober-minded, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance.
verses.comment: The call for older men to be models of Christian virtue is seen throughout the New Testament. Perseverance here echoes the necessity of enduring in the faith.

verses.text: Older women likewise are to be reverent in their behavior, not slanderers or enslaved to much wine. They are to teach what is good,
verses.comment: Women hold a vital role, teaching by example and instruction, closely tied to the concept of spiritual motherhood (cf. 1 Tim. 2:15).

verses.text: so that they may train the young women to love their husbands and children,
verses.comment: Passing on the faith and Christian virtue to the next generation is a communal responsibility.

verses.text: to be self-controlled, pure, working at home, kind, and submissive to their own husbands, so that the word of God may not be dishonored.
verses.comment: The structure of the family is viewed as a witness to the faith. 'Working at home' does not exclude other roles, but prioritizes the order within the household.

verses.text: Likewise, urge the younger men to be self-controlled in everything.
verses.comment: Self-control is presented as foundational for all believers, echoing the fruit of the Spirit (Gal. 5:23).

verses.text: Show yourself in all things to be a model of good works, and in your teaching, show integrity and dignity,
verses.comment: Titus, as a leader, must be both teacher and example, according to the apostolic pattern.

verses.text: with sound speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be put to shame, having nothing evil to say about us.
verses.comment: The witness of one's life must support the message of faith, protecting the reputation of the church.

verses.text: Bondservants are to be submissive to their masters in everything. They are to be well-pleasing, not argumentative,
verses.comment: In the first century, instructions to slaves focused on obedience as part of Christian witness. This is not an endorsement but a practical exhortation for the culture of the time.

verses.text: not pilfering, but showing all good faith, so that in every way they may make the teaching about God our Savior attractive.
verses.comment: Honest conduct brings honor to the faith and draws others toward the truth of the gospel.

verses.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all people,
verses.comment: This refers to Christ’s incarnation (see John 1:14). Salvation is made universally available, fulfilling prophecy regarding the Messiah's saving grace.

verses.text: teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age,
verses.comment: Grace is not merely pardoning, but transformative, empowering the believer to live a holy life.

verses.text: waiting for the blessed hope, the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,
verses.comment: 'Our great God and Savior Jesus Christ' is one of the clearest New Testament declarations of Jesus’ divinity, highlighting both His first and second coming.

verses.text: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all lawlessness and to purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works.
verses.comment: Echoes Old Testament language (see Ex. 19:5), showing believers as God's treasured people, redeemed through sacrifice—pointing to a spiritual priesthood set apart for good works.

verses.text: Declare these things; encourage and rebuke with all authority. Let no one disregard you.
verses.comment: Paul entrusts Titus with authority rooted in apostolic succession, emphasizing the office of teaching and discipline within the visible church.
